meanings.definition: The act of contaminating something again.
meanings.sent1: The recontamination of the water supply led to widespread illness.
meanings.sent2: After the cleanup, the recontamination of the area was a major concern.
meanings.sent3: The recontamination of the picnic food by ants turned it into an unintentional ant buffet.
meanings.sent4: The recontamination of the crime scene with new evidence puzzled the detectives.
meanings.sent5: The recontamination of the air with pollutants made it hard to breathe.

meanings.definition: The state of being contaminated again.
meanings.sent1: The recontamination of the soil was evident from the foul smell.
meanings.sent2: The recontamination of the food caused a second wave of sickness.
meanings.sent3: The recontamination of the classroom with glitter after the cleanup made the teacher sigh.
meanings.sent4: The recontamination of the river with trash painted a grim picture of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The recontamination of the wound delayed the healing process.
